metadata.title: CVE-2024-26936 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: ksmbd:validate request buffer size in smb2_allocate_rsp_buf() The response buffershould be allocated in smb2_allocate_rsp_buf before validating request. Butthe fields in payload as well as smb2 header is used insmb2_allocate_rsp_buf(). This patch add simple buffer size validation toavoid potencial out-of-bounds in request buffer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-26936` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-118-generic - 5.15.0-118.128~20.04.1
